verses.verse: This is the book of genealogy for Adam. When God created man, he made him in the likeness of God;
male and female he created them. He blessed them and named them “human.”
Adam was one hundred and thirty years old when he had a son in his likeness, who was named Seth.
After he had Seth, Adam lived another eight hundred years and had other sons and daughters.
Adam lived for nine hundred and thirty years, and then he died.
Seth was one hundred and five years old when he had Enosh.
After he had Enosh, he lived another eight hundred and seven years and had other sons and daughters.
Seth lived for nine hundred and twelve years, and then he died.
Enosh was ninety years old when he had Kenan.
After he had Kenan, Enosh lived another eight hundred and fifteen years and had other sons and daughters.
Enosh lived for nine hundred and five years, and then he died.
Kenan was seventy years old when he had Mahalalel.
After he had Mahalalel, he lived another eight hundred and forty years and had other sons and daughters.
Kenan lived for nine hundred and ten years, and then he died.
Mahalalel was sixty-five years old when he had Jared.
After he had Jared, he lived another eight hundred and thirty years and had other sons and daughters.
Mahalalel lived for eight hundred and ninety-five years, and then he died.
Jared was one hundred and sixty-two years old when he had Enoch.
After he had Enoch, he lived another eight hundred years and had other sons and daughters.
Jared lived for nine hundred and sixty-two years, and then he died.
Enoch was sixty-five years old when he had Methuselah.
Enoch walked with God.[a] After he had Methuselah, he lived another three hundred years and had other sons and daughters.
Enoch lived for three hundred and sixty-five years.
Enoch then walked with God and was no more for he was with God.
Methuselah was one hundred and eighty-seven years old when he had Lamech.
After he had Lamech, he lived another seven hundred and eighty-two years and had other sons and daughters.
Methuselah lived for nine hundred and sixty-nine years, and then he died.
Lamech was one hundred eighty-two years old when he had a son.
He named him Noah, saying, “This one shall be a consolation for the work and labor that we must endure because the LORD has cursed the soil.”
After he had Noah, Lamech lived another five hundred ninety-five years and had other sons and daughters.
Lamech lived for seven hundred and seventy-seven years, and then he died.
Noah was five hundred years old when he had Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
